intro: Bifrenaria tetragona var. rupicola, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions. Its unique morphology makes it a striking addition to rock gardens and arid landscapes.
